title: thunderbird e-mail
content: Sir or Madam, I can not receive e-mail in Thunderbird . I am a long time user (10) years. On Sept 8, 2023 the "get messages" button stopped working. First it would say "can not receive working off line" I was not working offline or had I clicked on "File-work offline" I thought maybe I needed to update so I updated to v.115.2.2 . Now when I click "get new messages" it does nothing. I tried "File-Get new messages for>" , Nothing. All other functions work, I can compose and send messages. I am using this to retrieve e-mail from Optimum.net. I can still access optimum with my android phone or go direct to optimum. I am using Firefox 115.0.3 and windows 7 home premium v 6.1 Any thoughts besides "update windows"? Thanks Chris
creator: rpfpinc

title: Cannot send emails.
content: Using Thunderbird email, and after the recent update, I cannot send emails. I receive them, but cant send them. Doublechecked my servers (Hotmail) SMTP, and everything is enetered correctly. Dont know where to go next. I have images, but they dont appear in the folder where I saved them!
creator: request32

title: Number of Unread Messages in 115.2.2
content: Before 115.2.2 Supernova, I used to see the number of unread messages in the bar at the bottom. It's now gone. How do I restore it?
creator: DrStrange10150

title: Can I use Xnote++ and Full Address Column with 115.2.2?
content:
Under Windows 11 I just upgraded to 115.2.2, from 102.11.2, and have lost the use of Xnote++ and Full Address Column. Both, are a big deal to me, what is the workaround? I find the “From” column to be useless for seeing who email is from. Also, I am a heavy user of Xnotes to keep up with information/notes I keep on emails I receive and/or sent. Good news when using 115.2.2, it is working with my POP accounts and my Outlook account with QAuth.

Bad News: So far I have not succeed in restoring my old 102.11.2 program and profiles. But, (Good News) I did get the 115.2.2 version back up and working.

QUESTIONS: How/when will I get my Xnotes++ information back under 115.2.2? How/when will I get the Full Address Column back under 115.2.2?

If the above two are DOA then I need to get back to v102.
creator: at1357

title: All incoming mail goes direct to JUNK, how do I correct it?
content: All incoming emails go directly to the Junk folder. Cannot seem to correct. Can you help?

title: Scroll bar doesn't work ANYWHERE in Thunderbird Supernova on Mac 13.5.2
content: Not only does the scroll bar not work on the mailboxes but it doesn't work on anything within the new Thunderbird SuperNova. How do we downgrade??

title: The mailbox scroll bar does not work
content: What was an annoyance has now become a pain. I have upgraded to 115.2.2 (64-bit) SuperNova and while I like it the issue of the mailbox scroll bar is now worse than ever. The mailbox scroll bar disappears and does not come back until you page up all the way to the top of the mailbox list and even then does not reappear sometimes. I have a lot of mailboxes that do not all fit on one screen. Please bring back the scroll bar so that when the cursor is inside the mailbox list area the scroll bar automatically shows up, like it used to do a couple of versions back.

title: Thunderbird 115 permissions
content: Accepted Thurnderbird 115 as an upgrade but now I have a Microsoft window telling me I've not given Thunderbird permissions. Also windows on Thunderbird cannot be adjusted so the area to read messages is only one inch high.

title: How do I turn off the 'header' panel
content: Recently a 'header panel' began taking up the bottom inch or so of the 'message list panel'. Not sure if it's called the header panel, but it simply displays the header items from the currently selected item in the message list panel. I've looked thoroughly in the View options and the Settings for info about this feature but have found nothing. I can live with it, but the message list basically shows header content too, so I don't need it.
creator: dncollins

title: Is 'Mozilla Thunderbird Email' in the Windows Store maintained by Mozilla?
content:
I have a few pieces of software installed through the Windows Store, just to streamline updates (especially for LibreOffice). Today, I saw a listing for Mozila Thunderbird Email, by Mozilla Thunderbird.

Of course, I don't want to download or use this if it isn't 100% legitimate. I can't see any press releases around it, but that would sort of make sense. I know Firefox is on the Windows Store, is Thunderbird too?
creator: louis.sandiford

title: "Contacts" filter doesn't work since recent automatic upgrade
content: My Thunderbird was apparently automatically upgraded recently--at least the icon has changed somewhat. Now the "filter" option on my list of emails doesn't work the way it used to. I typically look at emails from people in my address books first by using the "Contacts" filter, but that no longer does anything. The "Unread Messages" filter also doesn't do anything. I really rely on the Contacts filter--hope someone can help. I did shut down and restart the computer, which didn't help; I don't really know how to reload Thunderbird (fairly clueless--won't understand a very technical answer).
creator: kkearney1

title: Thunderbird 115 Calendar not sending or recieving invites or deletions to events
content: The System updated today to TB 115.2.2 Now when I create or change an event it is behaving oddly and creating errors. 1. When I invite someone that is in my address book to the event, it places that person in the invite screen twice along side two or three “blank” people and it won’t let me delete the extra people or the double entry. (I have checked – they are in my address book only once). 2. When I send that invitation none of them arrive but I get an email telling me I have accepted the invitation – even though I am the organiser 3. If I delete an existing event, regardless of whether it is an event created with earlier TB versions or a new one I have created today, – and say yes to notify all attendees – it emails me to tell me I have declined the invitation but doesn’t email any other attendees. It does not tell me that the event has been deleted. 4. If I just create a new event (with no additional attendees) and then delete it I get an email saying that I have declined the invitation to the event.... Is it possible to go back to the previous version (102) and stop it updating to this one? As this version is essentially unusable.
creator: jnphilips

title: Emails as text
content: I am unable to send emails as text to my Tmobile android smart phone. I get no error message. The text just never arrives. I am using a gmail address in my thunderbird account. I can successfully send email from my gmail account but not using Thunderbird. I can send emails as text to Verizon and AT&T phones. I can send text messages to Thunderbird from my Tmobile phone. It used to work but has not for at least 2 months or more. Very inconvient. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Poderiam me ajudar ?

Obrigado

title: Email list header Columns order
content:
When you create a New folder, the default order of the columns in the Email List Header seems to be 

- Thread - Starred - Attachment - Read Status - Correspondents - Spam - Date

I need a different columns orders and I can easily change it by right click on the header.

The problem is that if you create a new folder OR move the existing (and already customized) folder to a new location (another folder or subfolder), my custom columns order is lost and the default one (above) is applied.

I can use "Apply Current View to...." feature. But it applies to existing folders only and does not change the default order above. If I create a new folder after applying the "Apply Current View to...." feature, the new folder gets the default columns order again.

Question : how to change the Default order of the columns in the Email List Header once and forever.

title: How to change line spacing in message list - unthreaded view
content:
With the release of TB115 the line spacing in the message list is much tighter than it was in previous versions. I have an userChrome.css file and it is working just fine for the folder list but I can't get it to work for the message list.

#folderTree { line-height: 18px !important; } - this works fine to increase the line height in the folderTree

None of the following work to increase the line height in the message list

#threadTree > treechildren { line-height: 18px !important; } #threadTree > treechildren::-moz-tree-row { line-height: 18px !important; } #threadTree { line-height: 18px !important; }

Just in case it is interfering, you should know that I have also set layout.css.devPixlesPerPx to 1.75 to make all the fonts bigger.

Any help that you could provide would be much appreciated before my eyes go cross-eyed from reading the very tightly spaced message list.

creator: axw

title: Permanent addres book down loading message (Thunderbird/Linux, using shared profile between user account)
content:
I am the sole user on a Linux-desktop and have an 'admin' (sudo'er) and 'normal' user account.

They both run Thunderbird (v115) and access a common/shared profile in a shared directory under /home.

Both users successfully send/receive emails and administrate the local-folders' architectures.

However, the 'normal' user, upon opening Thunderbird has the Address book downloading.. window permanently displayed. The messages ends with (undefined).

There appears to be multiple instances stacked/repeated behind the displayed one. Otherwise Thunderbird provides normal use with the permanent message window going to the background. The 'cancel' button returns a 'kill' button which simply returns an 'ok' when repeatedly hit. Closing Thunderbird does not close the message window.

The 'admin' user does not have this problem. The message window briefly appears then closes.

The shared folder was created by 'admin' (sudo'er) and its parent is /home. Ownership is admin:public. Group public has only admin and 'normal' user as its members. There is no user called 'public'.

Shared folder is set with access rights '2774'. The old profile from 'admin' was initially copied into the new created Thunderbird profile. This had worked for 'admin' but the 'normal' user received an announcement stating "Thunderbird is already open" and so could go no further. Setting all group access rights to '7' (rwx) in the shared profile resolved this.

Not life-threatening but any help would be appreciated.

Linux 6.1.51-1-MANJARO Thunderbird 6.1.51-1-MANJARO Mozilla (Thunderbird for Manjaro LinuxManjaro - 1.0) HW Thinkpad T420 (???? a.d.)
creator: peter_pollard

title: Attachment pane too small
content: When I receive an attachment in TB115, the text '1 (or more) attachment' appears at the bottom of the window. But if I click on the arrow on its left, the list opens only for 1 mm in height and I cannot see the details of the list. Is it possible to increase the height of the list?

title: Only a subset of the selected items get moved
content:
When I select a large number of messages in my Inbox and move them to a different folder, only a subset of the selected messages get moved.

Procedure: I select a message, scroll backwards in the message list by several months, then shift-click another message, causing all messages between those two to also be selected. Then I either left-click and drag the messages to another folder, or right-click and Move To a different folder. Initially, all the messages disappear from my Inbox, giving the appearance that they all have moved to the folder, but one by one, many of the messages reappear in Inbox.

The folder is not a local folder--It's a folder on the server. It seems that the number of messages that successfully move is limited to about 200 messages, but it varies. For example, I selected and moved 211 messages, but when they finished moving, 17 messages returned to the Inbox. The messages that returned are not in the folder that I moved the messages to -- They either didn't move, or they moved and then returned to Inbox.

I'm using Thunderbird 115.1.1 with an IMAP Yahoo mail account.
creator: drkaden

title: Donations and Contact
content:
Hi

Why does Thunderbird want all my personal information.......??

I'd be MORE THAN happy to make a donation to support you guys, but I am NOT happy about all the info I have to provide - and frankly I'm bot going to be bullied into giving info I don't want to. I donate to Wikipedia and they don't ask such intrusive questions - so why do you? You say that less than 2% of TB users donate - this PROBABLY the reason why they don't...!

And the fact that there is no direct link to ask somebody ask question about this subject, is really frustrating.

Thanks
creator: minkwa1

title: Cannot reply to verizon.net users
content:
I do NOT use Verizon.net, Outlook.com only.

Prior to your recent release 115.2.2 (64-bit). I could receive and reply, or simply create and send a message to my brother. I can no longer do either. It's amazing how many search engine ASS U ME that I am a verizon.net user.

There is a big window that pops up with a lot of information and quickly disappears. I cannot seem to get a screen capture of it. There was a message much later about SMTP could not verify my password. I know the message to be BS because I have already sent 3 messages today, two of which were replies.

Hopefully you can tell me what has happened.

Thank you, Steve
